ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate

Class Chooser<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate.PairAggregator<T>
      • ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate.Chooser<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Aggregator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChooserOnArgument, Max, Min

    public abstract class Chooser<T>
extends PairAggregator<T>
    An abstract class that define the behaviour af an Aggregator which aggregates two items of a collection just by choosing one of them.
    Author:
    Mario Fusco

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Chooser() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T aggregate(T first, T second)
      Chooses on the two items returning the non-null one if one of them is null or by applying the strategy defined by the choose(Object, Object) method if both of them are not null
      protected abstract T choose(T first, T second)
      Chooses between two non null items.
      T emptyItem()
      Just returns null which is the idempotent item for a choosing aggreagation

      • Methods inherited from class ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate.PairAggregator

        aggregate

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public T aggregate(T first,
          T second)
        Chooses on the two items returning the non-null one if one of them is null or by applying the strategy defined by the choose(Object, Object) method if both of them are not null
